meanings.definition: relating to the form or structure of an organism
meanings.sent1: The scientist made detailed morphologic observations of the insect's wings.
meanings.sent2: The morphologic features of the flower helped in identifying the plant species.
meanings.sent3: The morphologic puzzle of the jigsaw was challenging to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her morphologic analysis of the building revealed hidden architectural secrets.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the morphologic beauty of the landscape in his painting.

meanings.definition: the study of the form and structure of organisms
meanings.sent1: In biology class, we learned about morphologic differences between species.
meanings.sent2: The professor's research focused on morphologic variations in marine life.
meanings.sent3: The children found the morphologic textbook filled with colorful illustrations.
meanings.sent4: She delved into the world of morphologic studies to understand evolution better.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit showcased the fascinating world of morphologic diversity.
